newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: India tenders to buy 25,000/T Feb 8-12 gasoline.
newsitem.headline: India tenders to buy 25,000/T Feb 8-12 gasoline.

text.p: State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) has issued a tender to buy 25,000 tonnes of 87-octane leaded gasoline for delivery February 8-12 to Goa or Kandla on the west coast, industry sources said on Monday.
The tender closes January 15 and is valid until January 17.
IOC issued a tender last week to buy a cargo of the same grade for delivery Janaury 16-31 in a tender which closes January 9.
IOC's tender is geared to filling a temporary imbalance, an industry source said. He said there were no supply problems with any refineries.
On average, India purchases 10 to 12 cargoes of gasoline a year, he said.
IOC's last gasoline purchase, for January 1-15 delivery, was from a western trader at $3.60 per barrel over Singapore 92-octane quotes, on a cost-and-freight basis.
